result.execSummary:
The defendant Mariah A Wittnik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on Ct. 3.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action on Ct. 1.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
No contact with victim without her consent and consent of probation agent.

Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 1 year upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections. Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must write a minimum 300 word apology letter to the victim. This to be done within the first 30 days of probation.

timeConds.notes: 30 days stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. *Additional 15 days stayed if restitution and DA surcharge are paid in full within the 60 day report period. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.
To perform 20 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

records.addlTxt: DC Jail Request for Sentence Modification - Defendant requests furlough to attend her grandmothers funeral. Court approves request with return later Wednesday.
from defendants mother requesting furlough to attend her grandmothers funeral. Court responds - can apply for furlough through the jail. DTE
Door County Jail - Petition for Sentence Modification. Court revokes huber/work release for the remainder of the inmate's incarceration.

Restitution summary

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minute sheet Court reviews events in file. State amends Ct. 3 to Misdemeanor Theft, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1. and amended Ct. 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1 and amended Ct. 3. Court dismisses Cts. 2, 4, & 5 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik appears by phone with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer indicates defendant delivered baby last week, asks court to set matter out 30 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 11:30 am.

from Atty Schaefer indicating defendant will not be able to appear today because of a medical issue. State would like to see some medical proof. Court indicates defendant can appear by phone for hearing.

Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews letter from Atty Schaefer regarding defendants appearance today. Court had indicated defendant could appear by phone for this mornings hearing.  Case was called at 8:20 am and defendant hasn't called in yet this morning. State would like to see some medical documentation from defendant, requests bench warrant. Court not issuing warrant today, will give Atty Schaefer some time to get medical verification from defendant, reschedules matter.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer just moved to Two Rivers and has started a new job. Defendant is not able to pay the restitution within the 6 month time period as presented in the State's offer. State not willing to put matter off until January. Atty Schaefer requests another status so she can talk to ADA Korb about the offer. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Status conference at 09-24-2015 03:30 pm
Status conference at 09-22-2015 10:30 am
Defendant called at 10:26 am. Car broke down, didn't have a ride to court. Clerk LS advised defendant to contact her attorney.

Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 8:56 am, reviews events in file. No appearance by defendant. Atty Schaefer has no explanation as to defendants whereabouts.  State requests bench warrant. Atty Schaefer asks court to stay signing the warrant for 24 hours to give her time to locate defendant and make other arrangements for her to appear. Court orders bench warrant but stays signing it until noon on 9/11/15 to allow Atty Schaefer time to locate defendant.
Court apptd atty bill from Steve Johnson. Court approves bill.

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer has not received file from Atty Johnson or Atty Gerbers, requests another date in 30 - 45 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant wishes to have court appoint a new attorney to represent her. Court excuses Atty Johnson from the case, he can submit his bill to the county. Court questions defendant on missed atty fee payments. Defendant gets paid on Thursday, will make a payment then. Court questions defendant on appointing new counsel. Defendant would like to talk to PD before proceeding. Defendant leaves to talk to Atty Gerbers. Defendant returns with Atty Gerbers. Atty Gerbers indicates defendant qualifies for PD representation, requests some time to get up to speed on the case. State indicates original offer will be extended to 7/24/15 court date. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises of offer from State that Defendant wants to accept that includes payment of $478.69, Defendant is in process of moving to Appleton, entering school, can pay in mid-June. Defense requests June plea/sentencing hearing. State has no objection. Bond continues as is.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 11:30 am.
State's Discovery Demand
Defense Discovery Demand
Defense indicates they will waive reading of Information when it's filed assuming it contains the same charges as shown in the criminal complaintand and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will file the Information by end of the day today.

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint. Atty Johnson indicates defendant will be waiving her right to a preliminary hearing today.  Status conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Contract for Repayment of Court-appointed Attorney Fees

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews defendants petition for court appointed attorney. Court appoints Atty Steve Johnson to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $100 per month toward attorney fees. First payment due by 1/15/15. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on where she's at in retaining an atty. Defendant has a meeting with an atty this week, also has court appointed paperwork filled out if meeting doesn't work out for her. Court reschedules. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant why she's not in court in person. Defendant advises she has the flu. Court questions defendant on where she's at in retaining an atty. Defendant has filled out form for court apptd atty, will drop off tomorrow. Court advises defendant she needs to be in court in person next Monday as this is her second phone appearance. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD representation, requests time to retain an atty or fill out form for court appointed attorney. If defendant wishes to go with court appointed atty, she's to fill out form and file it with the court before her next appearance. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mariah A Wittnik appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant on phone appearance. Defendant indicates she's having car trouble. Court reschedules.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
